definition: to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate

sentences.english: It is nearly impossible to disprove a rumor.
sentences.chinese: 要辟谣几乎是不可能的。

sentences.english: A rush of salt in the multilateral tide, under the rumours, gradually died down.
sentences.chinese: 一场食盐的抢购潮，在多方辟谣之下，逐渐平息。

sentences.english: First, let's dispel some common myths about raw milk.
sentences.chinese: 首先，让我们为生奶一些常见的误解辟谣。

sentences.english: She has dismissed the rumours of her resignation as pure speculation.
sentences.chinese: 他辟谣说，有关她辞职的传闻纯属猜测的事。

sentences.english: Yu denied all the death rumors via micro-blog shortly after they buzzed online.
sentences.chinese: 余秋雨经过其微博第一时间发布辟谣声明。

definition: clear (of liquid)/limpid/to clarify/to make sth clear/to be clear (about the facts)
to settle (of liquid)/to become clear (by precipitation of impurities)/precipitate (chemistry)/to put in order/to quell disturbances
(of video clips, rumors etc) to circulate on the Internet
to confirm (sth to be true)/to verify
lit. wind from an empty cave (idiom)/fig. unfounded (story)/baseless (claim)
(Internet slang) to get unjustly ridiculed, attacked, implicated in sth etc while just being present/abbr. for 躺著也中槍|躺着也中枪[tang3 zhe5 ye3 zhong4 qiang1]
government/official (approved or issued by an authority)
